comment: No one shows up to the class because its an easy A, but she is the most engaging teacher I've ever had. She is extremely knowledgable and passionate about art history and I loved going to class. She is also very witty. If you have an interest in art PLEASE take her and attend, it was my most favorite class I've ever had.

Easiest A I've ever had. You don't have to show up to anything but the review and test days and can walk out with an A. The lectures are somewhat interesting if you do go, but she will essentially tell you whats on the test on the review day before.

If you care at all, it's basically impossible to make anything less than an A in her class. You could only show up to six classes (review days and test days) the whole semester & still make an A. I stopped going to class after I made a 100 on the first test and kind of wish I had kept going now just bc she was that cool, laid back, and funny

EASY A! Attendance isn't mandatory, but if there are less than 20 people there, she gives extra credit. there is a 2 page paper, in regards to a piece of art in a museum. 3 tests. There is a review day before each test where she practically give you the questions and answers to the exams. Would recommend. Lectures are short & entertaining. EASY A!

Although attending class is not mandatory and not worth any points, go to class because you don't know when she will give extra credit for attending.  Two, 2 page paper NO FINAL - No Midterm Just 3 tests. They can be really easy "A" if you take really good notes on the review day.

She is an AWESOME professor! Participation is not required but she makes her lectures super interesting and fun to listen to. She doesn't post lectures online but will have a review session the class before test that basically goes over the whole test, so if you miss some classes dont stress! Totally recommend for easy A!

She was so nice and so far the easiest class at KSU. It feels like a high school class. She makes it really interesting and has a good sense of humor. Gives reviews the class before the test with basically all the answers. You can skip other days, but might not want to because her class is actually fun! 10/10 would recommend. she is  great :'-)

EASIEST CLASS YOU WILL EVER TAKE. Attendance isn't mandatory to passing, however you do need to show up on test review days because she basically gives you the answers to the test! She also gives extra credit when less than 20 people show up. Her lectures are really interesting and she has a good sense of humor as well. Don't even buy the textbook

Professor Dusza kept the lectures interesting, test aren't bad she gives a review, do NOT skip that day if you want an A on tests. Only used the textbook whenever I could not make it to class. She is so much fun to take. Great Professor!

Highly recommended! She does not change test dates, so just show up the class before the test and take down notes from her study guide and you will be golden for the test. You must go to a museum during the semester. Gives extra credit for showing up during the semester when attendance is below 20 students. Don't buy the text book. It is never used

She was a great teacher, and I highly recommend! She made art interesting and it was pretty much impossible not to get an A in this course. She goes over the test question by question the day before the test. So, as long as you attend the class before the test and on test day you should get an A.

It's impossible to fail just go to the review which is the class before the test and you'll get an A. She is hilarious so you end up wanting to go even though you don't need to. she's super sweet and even though her classes are late you only have to go for the review and test dates to make an A. Do not buy he textbook, I repeat do not buy it.

Mrs. Dusza is probably one of the more hilarious and easiest teachers that you can take. You don't even have to show up to class but her lectures are so funny that you'll want to anyways. Plus if you show up to a class that barely has anyone in there, you can earn extra credit. I only went to class for reviews and test days and passed with an A.

She's hilarious!! Makes a joke of everything, yet very easy to learn from. Makes Art history interesting. Print studyguide before class and fill in while she goes over her powerpoint lectures. EASY A if you come for the review session and study the guide briefly. Honestly, so much fun. 1 page essay that's super easy, and 4 tests. TAKE HER!

Mrs. Dusza is an amazing teacher. One of the nicest teachers I've ever taken. You can tell she is super passionate about what she's teaching and she's very inspirational. She tries to crack jokes and is always smiling. You don't need to read the book, and attendance is optional but I highly suggest going since her lectures are very interesting.
She doesn't check attendance and the only days i attended class were test review days. She prints out test study guides and literally tells you all the answers to the test the class before the test.

It's literally impossible to fail this class. Attendance isn't mandatory. You don't need the book. You don't even have to take notes or pay attention. She gives a study guide and all the answers to the test on review day. Friendly, tries to make it interesting.
